title: Competitive Ruling: Yuekai ‘Cyk’ Chan, Thomas ‘LeeSa’ Ma, Bill ‘Eyla’ Nguyen

replies.body:
This really annoys me, you people just don't get it.

You are playing in the hope that you can one day be a professional esports player. (Why else would you be in the OCS)

Maybe if you want to get there it might be a good idea to start acting a lot more professional.

These types of thing degrade the community as a whole, so please just stop.

I don't think you understand the situation they're in.  If you want to go pro in OCE you either have to suffer financial loss, boost or get an actual job to support you.  Naturally, boosting is a tempting decision for these players.
If your choice is between doing something illegal and getting an actual job and you choose the first option you've really got to have a good hard look at your decision making

I am fully aware of the situation. I have been doing quite a bit of research into it lately. 

Answer this, how do you expect to attract investors, sponsors, fans, adverting and establish a marketable merchandising strategy (which would then give the players a reasonable income) with all the negative publicity that comes with these types of things going on?

When you're a multibillion dollar company and still cant get background checks right the first time. Let alone after multiple. Our first roster gone. Now a second. We come back stronger each time. See you in promos.
